009package Tools;
010
011import java.awt.Color;
012import java.awt.Font;
013
014import ij.IJ;
015import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
016import ij.plugin.PlugIn;
017import imagingbook.bookimages.BookImageCh01;
018import imagingbook.bookimages.BookImageCh02;
019import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils;
020import imagingbook.core.resource.ImageResource;
021
022/**
023 * Open one of the listed book images
024 * (still experimental!).
025 * 
026 * @author WB
027 */
028public class Show_Book_Images implements PlugIn {
029        
030        enum BookChapter {
031                Chapter_1,
032                Chapter_2,
033                ;
034        }
035        
036        BookChapter selectedChapter = null;
037        ImageResource selectedImage = null;
038
039        @Override
040        public void run(String arg0) {
041                
042                if (!selectChapter()) {
043                        return;
044                }
045                
046                IJ.log(selectedChapter.toString());
047                
048                // could not find a more elegant way for dispatching
049                // (what generic variable type can be used to hold BookImageCh01.class, etc.?)
050                switch(selectedChapter) {
051                case Chapter_1: selectImage(BookImageCh01.class); break;
052                case Chapter_2: selectImage(BookImageCh02.class); break;
053                }
054                
055                if (selectedImage == null) {
056                        return;
057                }
058                
059                IJ.log(selectedImage.toString());
060                IJ.log("inside JAR: " + selectedImage.isInsideJar());
061                
062                selectedImage.getImage().show();
063        }
064        
065        
066        boolean selectChapter() {
067                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog("Select book chapter");
068                
069//              gd.addHelp("<html>This is a help text.</html>");
070//              gd.addHelp(DialogUtils.makeHtmlString(
071//                              "This is a help text",
072//                              "consisting of multiple lines",
073//                              "which are concatenated."
074//                              ));
075                gd.addHelp("https://imagingbook.com");
076                
077                Font font = new Font("SansSerif", Font.BOLD, 12);
078                
079                gd.addMessage("A message for the user that is longer\nwith multiple lines.", font, Color.blue);
080//              gd.addMessage(DialogUtils.makeLineSeparatedString(
081//                              "A message for the user",
082//                              "with multiple lines."));
083                                
084                gd.addEnumChoice("Select chapter", BookChapter.values()[0]);
085                
086                gd.showDialog();
087                if (gd.wasCanceled()) {
088                        return false;
089                }
090                
091                selectedChapter = gd.getNextEnumChoice(BookChapter.class);
092                return true;
093        }
094        
095        // ---------------------------------------------------
096
097        <E extends Enum<E>> boolean selectImage(Class<E> enumClass) {
098                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog("Select book images");
099                
100                gd.addEnumChoice("Select image", enumClass.getEnumConstants()[0]);
101                
102                gd.showDialog();
103                if (gd.wasCanceled()) {
104                        selectedImage = null;
105                        return false;
106                }
107                
108                selectedImage = (ImageResource) gd.getNextEnumChoice(enumClass);        
109                return true;
110        }
111
112}
